item.title: Solar Impulse 2 leaves Arizona on record-breaking flight
item.description:
Solar Impulse 2 leaves Arizona on record-breaking flight

Solar Impulse 2 leaves Arizona on record-breaking flightby Staff WritersLos Angeles (AFP) May 12, 2016 The Solar Impulse 2 plane took off from Phoenix, Arizona en route to Oklahoma on Thursday, resuming its record-breaking quest to circle the globe without consuming a drop of fuel.

item.title: Watch "The Energy Gang" Live in New York
item.description:
Watch "The Energy Gang" Live in New York

Watch T he Energy Gang video archive of last night's Clean Energy Connections below! Join Stephen Lacey, Katherine Hamilton and Jigar Shah as they welcome special guests Yuliya Chernova of The Wall Street Journal and Chris Martin of Bloomberg News.

item.title: U.S. throws more money at solar power
item.description:
U.S. throws more money at solar power

disclaimer: image is for illustration purposes only The U.S. Energy Department said it has $25 million in funding to help software developers and utility provides better integrate solar power to the grid. "Our ongoing grid modernization work will help accelerate the widespread adoption of the clean energy resources that will define our low-carbon future" Lynn Orr, the Energy Department's undersecretary for science and energy, said in a statement.

item.title: Energy Storage: Can It Ever Happen?
item.description:
Energy Storage: Can It Ever Happen?

Although a predicted growth in electrical energy storage from US$200-m to US$19-by 2017 helps keep the faith, the industry is still confronted with many challenges. There are those who believe that the industry is coming into its own but we think this hype is premature since much of the potential of energy storage has yet to be fully realized and the market has still not taken off in a meaningful way.

item.title: The Dash for Energy Storage Solutions - Renewables Revisited
item.description:
The Dash for Energy Storage Solutions - Renewables Revisited

As intermittent energy from renewable sources becomes a significant portion of the grid, storage becomes paramount. It could literally save the renewables sector from collapse. Experts predict that the storage market connected to the wind power industry alone will be worth US$1.1-bn from now to 2015.

item.title: The Smart Grid-Empowered Consumer
item.description:
The Smart Grid-Empowered Consumer

The energy transformation demands that consumers become more empowered - at some level at least - to understand and manage their energy use. With the wider deployment of smart metering, utilities have been seeking to build closer relationships with customers and they are delivering strategies such as personalised billing and energy reports.

item.title: Gas - An energy renaissance that Europe shouldn't ignore
item.description:
Gas - An energy renaissance that Europe shouldn't ignore

Gas hasn't always been as widely available as electricity as an energy source, but the potential of power to gas from renewables, the growing use of biogas and the availability of natural gas are fast changing this. Gas is predicted to play an increasingly important role in our energy system of the future.

item.title: SunEdison's bankruptcy -Not a reflection of solar markets
item.description:
SunEdison's bankruptcy -Not a reflection of solar markets

Renewables poster child SunEdison has filed for bankruptcy and has left the UK residential solar market with its tail between its legs. While many believe that subsidy cuts in the UK market are causing companies to pack their bags, there are some that see the potential.

item.title: Temporary power supporting renewables growth
item.description:
Temporary power supporting renewables growth

The development of renewable energy has seen major growth due to the need for a more diversified global energy mix and long-term energy security. The EU has experienced a major shift in the last decade away from fossil fuels. According to the European Commission's Renewable energy progress report [2015], 26% of the EU's power is generated from renewables today.
